Entries.info: The encoder angle at which theta is zero.  Adjust this number to change the location of 0 phase when pulsing.
Samples a new pulsing zero angle based on the current angle
The encoder angle at which theta is zero.  Adjust this number to change the location of 0 phase when pulsing.
The number of pulses per rotation.
Set the motor's spinning direction (clockwise vs. counter clockwise) and flight mode (2D non-reversible vs. 3D reversible)

PWM Mode: Commands a fraction of battery voltage. This changes as the battery voltage changes. Standard ESCs use PWM. This is the least safe mode because the upper throttle limit is determined by the battery voltage. An improper pairing of the motor, propeller, and battery could result in overheating your motor.

Voltage Mode: Commands a voltage. The motor will behave the same way throughout the life of a battery, assuming the commanded voltage is less than the battery voltage. You must set the Max Voltage setting in the Tuning tab.

Velocity Mode: Closed-loop, commands a velocity. The controller will adjust the applied voltage so that the motor spins at the commanded velocity. This mode has faster reaction times. Only use this if you know the properties of your propeller. You must set the Max Velocity setting in the Tuning tab.

This index determines where in a control message from the flight controller the module should look to find the throttle value. The index set here should match the index the flight controller expects to pack throttle commands for this particular module in.

This index determines where in a control message from the flight controller the module should look to find its X-coordinate value for pulsing. The index set here should match the index the flight controller expects to pack the X-coordinate for this particular module in.

This index determines where in a control message from the flight controller the module should look to find its Y-coordinate value for pulsing. The index set here should match the index the flight controller expects to pack the Y-coordinate for this particular module in.

This mode determines how the module will decide on its maximum pulsing voltage for scaling incoming pulsing commands. In Supply Voltage mode, the supply voltage is used as the maximum pulsing voltage. In Voltage Limit mode, the pulsing voltage limit set by the user is used as the maximum pulsing voltage.
